intro: Diplycosia othmanii, commonly known as the Othman's diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually small and opposite, while its flowers are often white or pale in color. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
